people don't come it usually comes

what you need to do when you bring it

defrost it first because it is frozen
and defrosting it you want to make sure
that you do that in the refrigerator up
to about 6 hours you can even do it over
night you want to make sure that the
entire pack of filo is completely
defrosted before you begin using it
otherwise you might tear it this has
been drafted overnight and it's also
been sitting out at room temperature for
about 10 minutes so open up the plastic
and you should be able to if you've
purchased a nice brand of filo dough you
should be able to unroll it and there
shouldn't be any major tears or rips if
you see a discoloration around the edges
here or if there are a lot of dry spots
that are cracked that means that your
filo dough is old it's probably past its
expiration date and you really should
either return the package to the store
or go buy a different brand this looks

or you can kind of dampen it with a

will keep the dough from drying out too
much which will make it brittle which
will make it crack so filo is leaf in

there are other versions of phyllo dough

it's called cottage
ka ta ISI and we need to defrost it in
the same manner it comes frozen and when

it is kind of compact and you want to

like this and you can do so many

creates a little nest around whatever

I'm not going to be using this version

I'm not making baklava or any other

just little phyllo cups and the method
in using phyllo is all the same no
matter what dessert or dish you're
making so you will need to work sheet by
sheet or leaf by leaf and you can tell
that this is really good quality phyllo
dough and that it's not too old because
I could easily move it from one place to
the next now keep the others covered so
they do not dry out and one important
thing that you need to do whenever
you're working with phyllo is you need
to layer it with fat so similar to puff
pastry where you have layers of dough
and then layers with fat and then you
keep kind of rolling out and folding and
creating more and more layers you're
doing something very similar when you

you really want to be liberal with your

some people even clarify the butter
which is removing the milk solids if you
wanted to use an alternate fat as well
that would be fine here coconut oil
that's all the rage these days and you

sug
in between the layers so I'm using

but really what I'm doing here is I'm
creating multiple layers which in the

that steam will create air pockets which

but this is the process you're going to

you want to take each square of dough

and you want to really go every other
well of the muffin tin and you're just
going to gently push the sides and you

to help create a nice fluted shell and
this is a wonderful vessel for any sort

anything you want and these go into the

the sugar is going to get nice and
